summary: The Early Childhood Nutrition Improvement Act (H.R. 2818) aims to improve the Child and Adult Care Food Program. Key provisions include: clarifying eligibility criteria for child care centers, reviewing and reforming the serious deficiency process, authorizing reimbursements for additional meals/snacks, and adjusting the Consumer Price Index used for adjustments. It mandates the establishment of an advisory committee to reduce paperwork and provides for guidance and regulations to streamline program administration.
